result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: characterization instruments were described in Supporting Information. The electrochemical measurements were carried out in a three-electrode system (AgAgCl as the reference electrode, Pt as the counter electrode, and FTO conductive glass containing sample as working electrode) on CHI 760 E electrochemical workstation (Chenhua Instruments Company, China).The preparation method of working electrodes was as follows: 5 mg of photocatalyst was dissolved in 1 mL ethanol containing 5 vol Nafion, and the

composite can only detect a little CO, and no CH 4 is detected, which is due to the generation of CH 4 requires a large amount of CO (Fig. 6f) 42.The obtained CO may be generated on the intrinsic g-C 3 N 4 , which has little association with the heterojunction.The decreased photocatalytic activities are assigned to the poor redox ability of type-II heterojunction due to the high-potential charge carriers diffuse to the low potential of another photocatalyst. the pressure reached 40 kPa which was kept for half an hour to obtain an adsorption equilibrium.The temperature of the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction system was set at 20 C by cooling water circulation system, and a 300 W Xe lamp (CEL-NP2000) with an optical filter (l 400 nm) was used as the light source and positioned 15 cm above the photocatalytic reactor.The concentration of the main gas product was determined by a gas chromatograph (GC7920, Ar carrier) equipped with a hydrogen flame ionized detector

5 vol Nafion, and the homogenized slurry was formed by ultrasonic for 15 min.Then, 20 mL of slurry was dropped on the fluoride-tin oxide (FTO) conductive glass and covering approximately 0.2 cm 2 .The electrolyte was 0.1 M Na 2 SO 4 solution. Photocatalytic performance was firstly tested by TC removal under visible light at ambient temperature in the photochemical reactor (XPA-7, Xujiang Instrument, Nanjing).The 500 W Xenon lamp was selected as the light source, and ultraviolet (UV) light was removed with

dark to establish adsorption equilibrium.Afterward, the Xenon lamp was lighted up for photocatalytic reaction.4 mL TC-containing aliquots was sampled at a specific time interval and filtered with a 0.22 mm organic membrane. The TC concentration was determined by using an UVevisible spectrophotometer (UV-2450, Shimadzu, Japan) at 357 nm. The quenching experiments were performed by adding the tert-Butanol (TBA, 20 mmolL), p-benzoquinone (BQ, 1 mmol L), and Ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid disodium salt

The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

(UV) light was removed with a 400 nm cut-off filter. The circulating cooling water was used to avoid thermal effect in the photocatalytic reaction process.A typical photocatalytic TC removal experiment was prepared as follows: 50 mg of the as-prepared photocatalyst was added to 50 mL of TC solution (10 mgL) and ultrasonicated for 10 min to form a homogeneous suspension system.Prior to the light irradiation, the suspension system was magnetically stirred for an hour in the dark to establish adsorption

CO 2 on a photoreaction system (CEL-SPH2N, Beijing China Education Au-light Co., Ltd., China) in a gas-solid system.In brief, 20 mg of the asprepared photocatalysts was evenly spread in a groove with a diameter of 3 cm, and then the groove was placed in the middle of a top-irradiation-type two-necked photoreactor containing 3 mL of deionized water.Before light illumination, the reaction system was evacuated, and then high-purity CO 2 (99.999) was introduced into the system until the pressure reached 40 kPa

Abstract
h i g h l i g h t s g r a p h i c a l a b s t r a c t Z-scheme g-C 3 N 4 BVO heterojunctions are constructed by a sonochemistry method.Z-scheme charge migration pathway can enhance the charge separation efficiency.Charge transfer behavior can be switched by interfacial oxygen vacancies.Z-scheme g-C 3 N 4 BVO heterojunctions can effectively work in TC degradation and CO 2 reduction.
Experimental
